1.text: Lay the T-shirt flat with the front side down.

2.text: Smooth out any wrinkles in the shirt.

3.text: Fold the shirt in half vertically from left to right and line up the sleeves.

4.text: Bring both of the sleeves in towards the middle.

5.text: Take the top of the shirt and fold it in half horizontally to connect with the bottom.

6.text: Stack your T-shirts vertically to save space.

7.text: Use an Army roll to pack for traveling.

8.text: Lay the shirt face up on a flat surface.

9.text: Bring the bottom of the shirt up about 3–4 inches (7.6–10.2 cm).

10.text: Fold the shirt into thirds starting on the left side.

11.text: Take the right side of the shirt and fold it in towards the center.

12.text: Start rolling the shirt at the collar.

13.text: Tuck the rolled shirt into the fold at the bottom.

14.text: Lay the T-shirt so it’s sideways and smooth it out with your hands.

15.text: Imagine 2 lines that intersect across the middle and the top of the shirt.

16.text: Identify 3 points in the intersecting lines.

17.text: Pinch point A with your left hand and point B with your right.

18.text: Hold point A in place and bring point B to meet point C.
